item.title: 纽约正在探索建设核电的可能性
item.description: 纽约州要求原子能开发商和主要电力用户分享他们对在整个地区建设新核电项目的兴趣信息。【原文：The state of New York is asking atomic energy developers and major power users to share information about their interest in seeing new nuclear projects built across the region.】

item.title: 拜登将坚持停止液化天然气许可，能源部长发出信号
item.description: 能源部长詹妮弗-格兰霍尔姆（Jennifer Granholm）表示，拜登政府不会在总统任期于 1 月底结束之前决定任何天然气出口许可。【原文：The Biden administration won’t decide on any natural gas-export permits before the presidential term ends in late January, Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm signaled.】

item.title: COP29：风暴警报
item.description: 晚上好，来自巴库。将近一周过去了，我们不想说这一周是混乱的一周；如今这个标签的标准要高得多—；但眼看着一个国家的代表团走向出口，另一个国家的气候部长下周拒绝露面，这可不是什么好兆头。同时，谈判桌上的协议还需要经过无数个夜晚的反复修改。请继续阅读更多内容，并在 Bloomberg.com 上免费收看我们对 COP29 的所有报道。【原文：Good evening from Baku. Almost a week has gone by and we don’t want to say it’s been chaos — there’s a much higher bar for that label these days — but watching one country’s delegation head for the exit and another nation’s climate minister refuse to show up next week isn’t a great look. Meanwhile, the deal on the table is still due for many nights of heavy edits. Read on for more, and catch up with all of our COP29 coverage for free on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 罗斯柴尔德就新颖的债务转换交易为象牙海岸提供建议
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，罗斯柴尔德公司（Rothschild & Co）正在就一项旨在帮助象牙海岸为其最昂贵的约4亿欧元（约合4.2亿美元）债务进行再融资的掉期交易提供建议，该交易的条件将为财政和社会目标节省开支。【原文：Rothschild & Co is advising Ivory Coast on a swap designed to help it refinance around €400 million ($420 million) of its costliest debt at terms that would generate savings for fiscal and social goals, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.description: 世界第二大压裂服务公司自由能源公司（Liberty Energy Inc.【原文：The head of Liberty Energy Inc., the world’s second-largest fracking services company, has gained prominent endorsements as a potential pick for Donald Trump’s energy secretary.】

item.title: 初创企业从池塘中寻找下一种对抗气候的超级食品
item.description:
Whole Foods 将浮萍列为一种值得关注的食品趋势，因为初创公司正在努力种植一种可以减少用水和排放的植物。【原文：

Whole Foods has labeled duckweed a food trend to watch as startups work on growing a plant that can cut water use and emissions.

】

item.title: 全球经济未能兑现更高效地利用能源的承诺
item.description: 虽然这比扩大可再生能源规模或实现交通电气化更为平凡，但快速提高全球经济使用能源的效率被认为是全球实现气候目标的关键所在。【原文：Though it’s more mundane than scaling up renewables or electrifying transportation, rapid improvements in how efficiently the global economy uses energy are seen as vital if the world has any chance of meeting its climate goals.】

item.title: 新德里有毒空气引发遏制，学校开始上网
item.description: 印度首都连续第三天面临极差的空气质量，浓重的烟雾笼罩着首都，迫使当地政府实施交通管制，并命令学校改用网络授课。【原文：India’s capital city faced very poor air quality for the third day as thick smog enveloped the capital city, forcing the local government to implement traffic curbs and order schools to switch to online classes.】

item.title: 为钢厂供货的煤矿将面临新的甲烷审查
item.description: 随着联合国监督机构扩大其工作范围，为炼钢提供煤炭的矿山将在甲烷排放问题上面临新的压力。【原文：Mines supplying coal for steelmaking will face new pressure over methane emissions as a United Nations watchdog expands its work.】

item.title: 俄罗斯特使支持巴黎气候协议，希望特朗普也能这样做
item.description: 克里姆林宫特使表示，俄罗斯支持巴黎气候协定，并补充说他希望当选总统唐纳德-特朗普也能将美国留在这项具有里程碑意义的协定中。【原文：Russia backs the Paris climate agreement, the Kremlin’s envoy said, adding he hoped President-elect Donald Trump will also keep the US in the landmark agreement.】

item.title: 南非乔治称 13 亿美元气候目标可行
item.description: 南非环境部长迪昂-乔治（Dion George）表示，发展中国家设定的每年气候融资 1.3 万亿美元的目标是 "可行的"。【原文：Dion George, South Africa’s environment minister, said that the $1.3 trillion target for annual climate finance set by developing nations is “doable.”】

item.title: 晚季热带风暴袭击菲律宾和台湾
item.description: 随着西太平洋迎来七十多年来风暴最活跃的十一月，两个独立的风暴将在周末袭击菲律宾和台湾。【原文：Two separate storms are set to hit the Philippines and Taiwan at the weekend as the western Pacific Ocean sees its most storm-active November in more than seven decades.】

item.title: 人工智能在这个飓风季节经受考验
item.description: 早上好，我来自巴库。除了COP29上关于金钱和政治的讨论，人工智能在气候斗争中能发挥什么作用也备受关注。今天的时事通讯将探讨在气候变化影响日益加剧的情况下，人工智能技术如何预测本季飓风。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上免费阅读这篇报道以及我们对 COP29 的所有报道。【原文：Good morning from Baku. Aside from all of the talk about money and politics at COP29, there’s been a lot of interest in what role artificial intelligence can play in the climate fight. Today’s newsletter looks at how the technology did predicting hurricanes this season amid climate change’s intensifying influence. You can read this story — and all of our COP29 coverage — for free on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 纽约时报》称阿根廷考虑退出巴黎气候公约
item.description: 纽约时报》援引阿根廷外交部长赫拉尔多-韦尔泰因（Gerardo Werthein）的话报道，阿根廷正在研究退出具有里程碑意义的气候行动《巴黎协定》的可能性。【原文：Argentina is studying a potential withdrawal from the landmark Paris Agreement on climate action, the New York Times reported, citing the country’s Foreign Minister Gerardo Werthein.】

item.title: 隆基老板称陷入困境的中国太阳能行业正处于 "转折点
item.description: 中国最大的太阳能电池板生产商之一表示，饱受供应过剩和激烈价格战困扰的中国太阳能产业已经走上了复苏之路。【原文：China’s beleaguered solar industry, wracked by a glut and fierce price war, is already on the road to recovery, according to one of the country’s largest panel manufacturers.】

item.title: 人工智能天气模型在本飓风季大有可为
item.description:
研究人员正在努力找出新一批天气模型在风暴方面的正确之处—以及需要在哪些方面开展更多工作才能使人工智能预测发挥作用。【原文：

Researchers are working to figure out what a new crop of weather models got right about storms — and where more work is needed to make AI forecasts useful.

】

item.title: 重要碳机构批准自然补偿新标准
item.description: 一个重要的监督机构已经批准了新的自然补偿标准，此举有助于恢复投资者对饱受 "绿色清洗 "之苦的市场的信心。【原文：A key oversight body has approved new standards for nature-based offsets, a move that could help restore investors’ confidence in a market battered by greenwashing concerns.】

item.title: 热带风暴 "萨拉 "将给洪都拉斯带来灾难性洪灾
item.description: 热带风暴 "萨拉 "已在洪都拉斯沿海形成，有可能在整个中美洲引发灾难性的洪水和山体滑坡。【原文：Tropical Storm Sara has formed off the coast of Honduras, threatening to unleash catastrophic flooding and landslides across Central America.】

item.title: 美国大片地区在极寒时期面临供电风险
item.description: 今年冬天，整个美国东北部地区在极端寒冷天气下面临电力短缺的威胁，部分原因是为发电厂供电的天然气管道容量有限。【原文：The entire US Northeast faces an elevated threat of electricity shortages this winter during extreme cold weather, in part due to limited capacity on natural gas pipelines that supply power plants.】

item.title: 图恩是特朗普痛恨的能源--风能的忠实拥护者
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普憎恨风能。约翰-图恩可能准备保护风能。【原文：Donald Trump hates wind power. John Thune may be poised to protect it.】

item.title: 德国能源转型因肖尔茨临时大选而推迟
item.description: 德国政府的动荡意味着，在明年新政府成立之前，八项被认为对能源转型至关重要的立法将处于停滞状态，甚至有可能根本无法颁布。【原文：Germany’s government shakeup means eight pieces of legislation considered crucial for the energy transition are stuck in limbo until a new administration is formed next year, with the possibility they may not be enacted at all.】

item.title: 智利表示将怀念特朗普上台后的美国气候领导力
item.description: 智利最高环保官员在接受采访时说，在唐纳德-特朗普赢得总统大选后，美国在应对全球气候变化方面的领导作用将不复存在。【原文：Chile’s top environmental official said in an interview that US leadership in combating global climate change will be missed following Donald Trump’s presidential election win.】

item.title: 美联储拒绝支持巴塞尔气候计划，谈判陷入僵局
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，以美联储为首的美国监管机构拒绝批准巴塞尔银行监管委员会推动贷款机构披露气候风险的计划。【原文：US regulators led by the Federal Reserve have refused to endorse a plan that would have seen the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision push lenders to disclose their climate risk, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 拉合尔的世界最严重空气污染创下新纪录
item.description: 随着拉合尔的空气污染上升到创纪录的水平，巴基斯坦的雾霾情况变得越来越糟糕。【原文：Pakistan’s smog situation has gone from bad to worse as air pollution rose to a record in Lahore.】

item.title: COP29：华尔街在哪里？
item.description: 晚上好，来自巴库。COP29 的气氛有点紧张。阿塞拜疆和法国正在为殖民罪行吵得不可开交，阿根廷人已经收拾行囊回国，而大家需要达成一致的财政协议似乎遥遥无期。请继续阅读，并在 Bloomberg.com 上免费收看我们对 COP29 的所有报道。【原文：Good evening from Baku. The atmosphere has become a bit fraught at COP29. Azerbaijan and France are having a noisy fight about colonial sins, Argentinians have packed their bags and headed home and the finance deal everyone needs to agree seems a long way off. item.title: 纽约正面临十多年来最严重的野火季节
item.description: 纽约和东北部正处于十多年来最严重的火灾季节，由于干旱和大风的威胁，到本周五火灾的威胁将再次上升，几周内几乎看不到缓解的迹象。【原文：New York and the Northeast are in the midst of their worst fire season in more than a decade, with little relief in sight for weeks as drought and high winds threaten to raise the threat again by Friday.】

item.title: 中国铜买家削减年度合同，市场处于波动之中
item.description: 铜曾是全球金属市场的风向标，而中国的铜进口商们正在通过年度供应谈判来控制他们的购买吨数，转而选择现货供应。【原文：China’s copper importers are reining in the amount of tonnage they buy through annual supply negotiations, once a bellwether for the global metal market, and opting for spot supplies instead.】

item.title: 欧洲投资银行将为清洁技术提供 5 亿欧元银行担保
item.description: 欧洲投资银行将承诺为清洁技术公司提供 5 亿欧元的反担保，以帮助它们与全球竞争对手竞争。【原文：The European Investment Bank is set to pledge €500 million in counter-guarantees to clean-tech companies to help them compete with global rivals.】
